title: How should I ask my teacher for a letter of recommendation over email? - Quora

response.answer_text: Email the teacher something like this: “Dear Dr. [professor’s name]: “This [your name], from your class on blah blah from Spring 2020. I wanted to tell you how much I enjoyed the course! I particularly liked [insert details] about that class.” “Because I had such a good relationship with you in that class, I have a favor to ask. Would you be willing to write a letter of recommendation for me? I’m applying for [insert scholarship, or graduate school, or job], and I thought you’d be a good recommender because [insert reasons]. The deadline for the recommendations is [insert date at least two weeks away, preferably more], and you will submit the recommendation to [insert website, or physical mailing address, or explain how the submission process works]. “I’ve also attached an updated copy of my résumé and a list of my past accomplishments, my current GPA, my related experience, community activities, and awards for your convenience if you would like something to refer to as you compose the recommendation. I’ve included a brief paragraph providing details of the [insert scholarship, or graduate school, or job] I’m applying for to give you more context. “Are you willing and do you think you could write a positive recommendation for me? I’d be very grateful, but I know you’re busy, so I understand if you can’t. If you don’t think you could write a positive recommendation, I’d appreciate any advice on other possible recommenders. “Thank you so much for considering my request, and thank you for teaching me in your class. “Sincerely yours, [Your name.]”

Best practice is to ask in person. You will have an opportunity — invaluable — to talk about what your goals are, what you learned from the professor, and more. When asking by email, you run the risk that the professor may not have a clear idea of who you are. The letter might then reflect “he got an A in my class.” Not the best and most useful recommendation.
A2A. How should I ask my teacher for a letter of recommendation over email? Email is the worst way to ask for a letter of recommendation. If possible, I recommend you talk to your teacher via Skype.
